properties.areaDesc: Waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR from 10 to 60 nm; Coastal waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR out 10 nm
properties.headline: Hazardous Seas Watch issued January 30 at 3:13PM PST until February 1 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Hazardous
Seas Watch...which is in effect from Friday evening through
Saturday afternoon.

* WHAT...For the small craft advisory, south winds 20 to 25 kt and
steep seas 10 to 14 ft at 13 to 15 seconds. For the hazardous
seas watch, very steep and hazardous seas of 13 to 17 ft are
possible due to a mix of short period wind waves and west swell.

* WHERE...All areas will be impacted by conditions hazardous to
small craft through Friday evening then very steep hazardous
seas may develop late Friday evening through Saturday afternoon.

* WHEN...For the small craft advisory, until 10 PM PST Friday. For
the hazardous seas watch, from Friday evening through Saturday
afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Very steep and hazardous seas could capsize or damage
vessels. Bar crossing could become especially hazardous.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels, should remain in port and avoid the area of hazardous
conditions.

A Hazardous Seas Watch is issued when the risk of very steep and
hazardous seas has significantly increased, but the specific
timing and/or location is still uncertain.  It is intended to
provide additional lead time for mariners who may wish to
consider altering their plans.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST FRIDAY... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON
